intro: Lagenantha nogalensis var. papillosa, commonly known as the Papillate Lagenantha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive papillate (bumpy) structures on its leaves and stems, which give it its varietal name. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This species is often cultivated for its unique appearance and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
